name: material-entity
title: MaterialEntity
description: An entity that can be identified, exists for some period of time, and consists in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a particular instance of a MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (the MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: materialEntityType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of the MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `whole organism`; `heart`; `liver tissue sample`; `fossil`; `germplasm`; `skull`; `cast`; `3D printed model`; `printed photograph`

fields.name: sourceMaterialEntityID
fields.description: A unique identifier for an instance of MaterialEntity that was the sole source of this MaterialEntity.

fields.name: sourceDigitalMediaID
fields.description: A unique identifier for an instance of DigitalMedia that was the sole source of this MaterialEntity.

fields.name: gatheringEventID
fields.description: A unique identifier for the single Event in which this MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: preparations
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for the MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: disposition
fields.description: The current state of a MaterialEntity with respect to where it can be found.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: institutionCode
fields.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the MaterialEntity.

fields.name: institutionID
fields.description: The identifier for the institution (Agent) having custody of the MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: collectionCode
fields.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

fields.name: collectionID
fields.description: The identifier for the collection (Agent) of which the MaterialEntity is a part.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: ownerInstitutionCode
fields.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the MaterialEntity.

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the MaterialEntity within the collection.

fields.name: recordNumber
fields.description: An identifier given to the MaterialEntity at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and a MaterialEntity record, such as a specimen collector's number.

fields.name: collectedBy
fields.description: The Agent who recorded the MaterialEntity in the field.
fields.examples: `Jos√© E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson` (where the value in recordNumber `OPP 7101` corresponds to the collector number for the specimen in the field catalog of Oliver P. Pearson)

fields.name: collectedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent who recorded the MaterialEntity in the field.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)

fields.name: associatedReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). Note that the ResourceRelationship class is an alternative means of representing associations, and with more detail. Note also that the intended usage of the term dcterms:references in Darwin Core when applied to a MaterialEntity is to point to the definitive source representation of that MaterialEntity if one is available. Note also that the intended usage of dcterms:bibliographicCitation in Darwin Core when applied to a MaterialEntity is to provide the preferred way to cite the MaterialEntity itself.
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: associatedSequences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the MaterialEntity.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same MaterialEntity, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: materialEntityRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the MaterialEntity.
